Today in Your Health, why you'll almost always have to wait when you go to a hospital emergency room and why it's likely plenty of people will be waiting along with you, some for as long as two days.
That's the finding of a new report on emergency care in the United States by the Independent Institute of Medicine.
NPR's Joanne Silberner spent a night in a very busy ER to see what's causing the problem.
